That's a great idea! Leveraging your existing network in the Facebook group can be a fantastic way to find like-minded book lovers to join your club. Since you've already been active in the group and attended events, you've established a presence and built relationships with other members.

When reaching out to the group, you can create a post announcing your book club and inviting interested members to join. Here's a sample post to get you started:

"Hello fellow book lovers! I'm excited to announce that I'm starting a new book club and I'd love for some of you to join me! We'll meet [insert frequency] to discuss a new book and share our thoughts. Our focus will be on [insert genre or type of books]. If you're interested in joining, please send me a message or comment below. Let's get together and talk books!"

You can also consider creating a separate Facebook group or event specifically for your book club, where members can discuss the books, share updates, and connect with each other.

Additionally, you could reach out to the administrators of the Facebook group and ask if they'd be willing to promote your book club to their members. They might be happy to help spread the word, especially if your club aligns with the group's interests.

Remember to be clear about the details of your book club, such as the type of books you'll be reading, the meeting frequency, and any other important information. This will help attract the right members and set expectations from the start.

Good luck, and I hope your book club is a huge success!
